00034 #include "getopt.h"
00035 #include <stdio.h>
00036 #include <stdlib.h>
00037 #include <string.h>
00038 
00039 int  opterr = 1,     /* if error message should be printed */
00040      optind = 1,     /* index into parent argv vector */
00041      optopt,         /* character checked for validity */
00042      optreset;       /* reset getopt */
00043 char *optarg;        /* argument associated with option */
00044 char EMSG[] = "";
00045 
00046 #define BADCH   (int)'?'
00047 #define BADARG  (int)':'
00048 
00049 /*
00050  * getopt --
00051  *      Parse argc/argv argument vector.
00052  */
00053 int
00054 getopt(int nargc, char *const *nargv, const char *ostr)
00055 {
00056     static char    *place = EMSG;       /* option letter processing */
00057     char           *oli;        /* option letter list index */
00058 
00059     if (optreset || !*place) {  /* update scanning pointer */
00060         optreset = 0;
00061         if (optind >= nargc || *(place = nargv[optind]) != '-') {
00062             place = EMSG;
00063             return (-1);
00064         }
00065         if (place[1] && *++place == '-') {      /* found "--" */
00066             ++optind;
00067             place = EMSG;
00068             return (-1);
00069         }
00070     }                           /* option letter okay? */
00071     if ((optopt = (int) *place++) == (int) ':' ||
00072         !(oli = strchr(ostr, optopt))) {
00073         /*
00074          * if the user didn't specify '-' as an option,
00075          * assume it means -1.
00076          */
00077         if (optopt == (int) '-')
00078             return (-1);
00079         if (!*place)
00080             ++optind;
00081         if (opterr && *ostr != ':')
00082             (void)fprintf(stderr,
00083                           "getopt(): illegal option -- %c\n", optopt);
00084         return (BADCH);
00085     }
00086     if (*++oli != ':') {        /* don't need argument */
00087         optarg = NULL;
00088         if (!*place)
00089             ++optind;
00090     } else {                    /* need an argument */
00091         if (*place)             /* no white space */
00092             optarg = place;
00093         else if (nargc <= ++optind) {   /* no arg */
00094             place = EMSG;
00095             if (*ostr == ':')
00096                 return (BADARG);
00097             if (opterr)
00098                 (void)fprintf(stderr,
00099                              "getopt(): option requires an argument -- %c\n",
00100                              optopt);
00101             return (BADCH);
00102         } else                  /* white space */
00103             optarg = nargv[optind];
00104         place = EMSG;
00105         ++optind;
00106     }
00107     return (optopt);            /* dump back option letter */
00108 }
